channel.title: Help buying a new computer
channel.description:
hello
i am gonna buy a new computer, and was wondering if you cuties would help me out it will mostly be a gaming computer i prefer windows xp on it i want it to be able to run at 100 fps constantly on 1.6, and run fine.
I am also getting the RAZER Deathadder mouse :D
my price range is 450-650 (if comes with decent gfx card)
please help me out, thanks.

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

From the reviews ive read, the PSU in the case is a good one. and 500W should suffice.

Read full topic

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @nhawkesn nhawkesn
item.description:
@nhawkesn wrote:

i got a intel dual core e6600 and a radion 1950xt (great card) and i run source at 150-200 fps 90% of the time.

i suggest this combo because its quite cheap now and very effective.

also buy a reliable Power supply, the rest of the system doesnt matter that much for gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The actual assembly of the computer is about as hard as a medium sized lego set (the ones that cost $25 or so) You need to know how to operate a philips screwdriver and how to snap parts together. It is super-easy, my little brother builds his own computers.

That video card isn’t bad, but you can probably get an 8600 for $120 or so that would be considerably better, it all depends how much money you have.

Read full topic

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

The problem I am faced with is the actual assembly of the computer. I have never built before, and lawl said it was very hard. Any suggestions?

Also a link to a good video card please? I don’t know much about hardware :.

here, this would be sufficient?

newegg.com

EVGA GeForce 7600GT DirectX 9 256-P2-N615-TX 256MB 128-Bit GDDR3 PCI Express x16...

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The one I am building for the old man for $340 dollars won’t lag on WoW, if you wanted it for gaming you would want to shell out another $120 or so for a good video card (should be able to get an 8600GT or something for that much)

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Don’t buy a pre-built computer, instead get a much better computer for your money by building it. I always order parts from newegg.com.

Here is are some parts I put together for a 65 year old man that wants me to build him a new computer, in your case I may get a better MSI motherboard, another stick of RAM and an nvidia graphics card.

1 SAMSUNG 20X DVD±R DVD Burner Black IDE Model SH-S202J

	$24.99

1 Seagate Barracuda 7200.10 ST3160815AS 160GB 7200 RPM SATA 3.0Gb/s Hard Drive

Seagate Barracuda 7200.10 160GB 3.5" SATA 3.0Gb/s Hard Drive

	$52.99

Here is a handy link to add them all to your cart so you can see them better: http://secure.newegg.com/Shopping/AddToCart.aspx?Submit=Add&itemList=N82E16811147007|1%2CN82E16819115030|1%2CN82E16813130131|1%2CN82E16820146580|1%2CN82E16827151161|1%2CN82E16822148230|1

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“pko, post:7, topic:176633”]ok, thought so

and daviddude-

im a competitive game, and my logitech x310 isnt getting it done.

also-

I downloaded Windows XP SP2, but I have a question.

If it has no OS, how can I get Windows XP onto it?

edit AGAIN -

the computer without an OS, I can buy a OS with it, but that will just add to the price.

here are the two im looking at

iBUYPOWER Gamer 504-VE Athlon 64 X2 5200+ 1GB DDR2 250GB NVIDIA GeForce 8400GS Windows Vista Home Premium “Costs 600 dollars”

OR

Visionman Intel Gaming PC - Intel Pentium Dual Core E2160, 2GB DDR2-667, NVIDIA 8600GT 256MB DX10, 250GB SATA-2, 20X DL Lightscribe DVDRW, Media Reader, Logitech Speakers, No OS, 480 Watt PSU

which will end up costing about 680+[/quote]

It isn’t worth spending extra money for an operating system that sucks.

Sorry for off topic, but PKO why buy such a good mouse? Apart from the extra buttons I can’t see why you’d need such a high tech one… I bought my lazer mouse for £5 and i’ve had it for a year or two now and it hasn’t failed me and works perfect.

Just wondering why

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Yea, things become outdated fast.
And DDR2 has been in such high supply and demand that they went down to one fourth the price of regular DDR, which is in low supply so the price keeps going up. Irony.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Help buying a new computer
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

You should be able to get a kickass computer with that amount of money.
I just got a death adder a few days ago, and it pwns hard.

As for the computer, try to stick with a decent motherboard that supports an Athlon X2 (I like teh athlons) and DDR2. You can get 2 gigs of DDR2 for around $30 now (ddr1 is $60 for 1gig). DDR2>DDR1
The processor should be around 3 ghz? That’d make a good sized difference in your gaming.

As for a GPU, I would say nVidia. The 8600 and 8800 are really cheap now compared to what they started at, and with one of those, I doubt you will ever come across fps issues in 1.6, or even ‘Crysis’ for that matter.

A 500-watt power supply is fairly cheap these days, and its better to have more power than not enough for later upgrades.

Am I missing anything?
Oh yea. If you have any money left over, get a 7.1 Sound Card (with xram and eax HD 5.0).
Those things are epic, and will actually take stress off of your cpu and RAM, which in turn gives you more fps. lol.

Read full topic
